responses.rationale: The term 'high mortality rates' describes a factual characteristic/metric, not an intensifier modifying a risk-adjective in an authorial, emotional sense.
The segment describes factual impacts (birds killed, cost) but does not use an intensifier or comparative modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment describes detection of the virus but contains no intensifier or comparative modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment describes depopulation measures but contains no intensifier or comparative modifying a risk-adjective.
